newsitem.title: POLAND: Poles change 2.8 mln NFI units to shares.
newsitem.headline: Poles change 2.8 mln NFI units to shares.

text.p: Poles have exchanged 2,810,156 units in Poland's National Investment Fund (NFI) mass privatisation scheme into shares of the 15 funds, the National Securities Depository (KDPW) said on Monday.
Poles have been eligible to exchange their unit into 15 shares, one in each fund, from May 12.
The funds entered the bourse's main market on June 12.

A KDPW official told Reuters that by Monday 14.7 million of the 25.6 million units purchased had been converted into book-entry form, a step necessary for bourse trade. Under the government's NFI programme, shares in about 500 mid-sized companies are allocated to the funds run by foreign and domestic management firms.
